review.reviewBody: Sturdy, well made boot. Has great arch support and could wear these all day!
review.name: Chelsea Boot

review.reviewBody:
Overall, I like these boots. You always take a gamble when you purchase shoes online, but these have worked out pretty well so far.

I will echo the concern others have about these boots being very roomy, to the point of having your heels slip inside of them. I made the mistake of ordering a half size up, which I’m sure did not help (my rationale was I did not want the boots to feel too tight while wearing thick winter socks). Stick to your size! These boots are roomy as is.

In order to fix the heel slip I added a thin insole underneath the stock insole, and added some adhesive heel pads to the inside of the shoe. They took a few days to break in but now are pretty comfortable. They look and feel high quality, repel water as advertised, and have fantastic tread. The tread is one of my main reasons for wanting these, and I’ve had no problem walking through snowy parking lots in these. 

I wanted something cute and more “grown up” than my sneakers, and these fit the bill. I hope they last a long time!
review.name: Very roomy - stay true to size!
comment: Thanks for the stellar feedback Alli!

review.reviewBody: A darling Chelsea boot! It was perfect for our trip to Europe in December where we did lots of walking and traveling by train. I couldn’t be more pleased!
review.name: A darling Chelsea boot!

review.reviewBody: These were returned due to them being too "purple" for me.
review.name: Pretty but the color is not for me.

review.reviewBody: The Fields Chelsea Waterproof boot is amazing. They are very comfortable, no break-in time and cute. I bought these before a trip to New York and I wore them everyday walking everywhere! I am also a high school teacher and they look and feel great for school, as well. have gotten several complements and may get the brown, too!! They are true to size!
review.name: Chelsea Boots are fabulous!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and dry, i ordered a half size up and didn't need to, but have plenty of room for thicker socks if needed
review.name: Stylish and warm

review.reviewBody: Boots are well made and very cute. Arch support is good but not great for my feet. I can wear them around the office or out for short times but my arches started to hurt after a longer period of walking for a couple hours. I have very particular arch support needs that Chaco sandals are perfect for. They are otherwise reasonably comfortable for boots. Because I was hoping to have a shoe I didn't need to wear orthotics with, I probably wouldn't buy them again. But they could be fine for someone with less arch support issues. I'm typically 7.5 but 7 fit better.
review.name: Not bad

review.reviewBody: I get SO many compliments on these boots! They’re comfortable, warm without being hot, and absolutely waterproof. Great for fashion and function!
review.name: So many compliments!

review.reviewBody: I loved the boots in the photos but didnt like them at all after i got them. They remind me of rainboots, but not only that they rub my toes and unfortunately i cant return them. I have many pairs of different chacos from sandals, boots, and shoes…i love them all, but these boots are a hard no for me.
review.name: It’s a no for me!
comment: We appreciate your feedback Kari. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Very high arch that goes all the way to the outside of the foot so it feels like you’re stepping on something hard in your shoe. Also I wear a 8.5 but this is a half size too big. I have a pair of Chaco sandals I love and took a chance on an item they are not accepting returns for.
review.name: Uncomfortable insole
comment: We are sorry to hear that and would like to help in any way we can. Please give our customer service team a call at 888.211.1908.

name: Fields Chelsea Waterproof Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Goal Zero Nomad 20 Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nomad 20 Solar Panel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Goal Zero Nomad 20 Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have multiple Goal Zero products,  and they have workedfine.  I recently bought a yeti 200x, it seemed to work fine.  I just bought a Nomad 20.  Connected via the 8mm jack, to the yeti 200.  The yeti is a 45%, it been in full sunlight for over 8 hours.  And is still at 45%.  I have a solid Blue "charge" lite.  I checked on the internet to see if I'm doing something wrong.   I see about 20 articles, with other customers having the same issue.  Question, how do you sell a solar panel that will not charge your own device.  I'm getting ready to return the solar panel.  But I'm very disappointed.  From the articles on the internet,  it appears the issue has been going on since January 2024
review.name: disappointing

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my son to take to college with him so he can keep his Sherpa 100 charged in a power outage.  Did the same for my daughter.  The 20 is built well and works great to keep smaller power packs charged.  I have one and it has worked great over the years.
review.name: Easy way to recharge small power packs

review.reviewBody: I bought this to recharge my Sherpa 100PD.  After being in the sun 2 days, 12 hours both days in direct sun (on cloudless days), it only recharged the Sherpa 25%.  It might be OK for a phone, but not for what I needed.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Trying to use this to help maintain my goal zero 300. It’s maxing out at 7W. I would at least expect 10-15 in direct perfect sunlight.
review.name: Not hitting the power I need

review.reviewBody: The panel works but it is very heavy for a portable panel. I have to decide weather I'm taking my sherpa battery or the panel because both are to much on an expedition. On Everest in full sun it only charges at 8w therefore it takes quite a while to fill the battery
review.name: Works but pretty heavy!

review.reviewBody:
I bought this a year ago and have been using it to charge portable batteries while camping. Some things it charges normally like my big batteries. Anything smaller sized like my phone or smaller power batterIes takes FOREVER to charge even in strong sunlight. Also a major design flaw with the folding panel is that the creases where the folds are always want to swing shut when it’s cold. I have to pry them open with rocks and sticks to keep it from constantly closing until the sun warms it up enough to loosen the plastic creases enough to stay open. 
Bottom line: don’t waste your money on expensive poor quality goal zero products. Spend less on something better quality.
review.name: Too expensive for poor performance

review.reviewBody: I used Goal Zero for a 1,500-mile, 75-day solo canoe and kayak expedition. (PaddleQuest 1500) The equipment performed so well that I upgraded for a recent Everglades circumnavigation expedition. Keeping the Venture 75 on charge all day, even with filtered sunlight gave me the juice necessary to keep navigation, communication and lights topped off. It’s good to venture into the wilderness confident in my essential equipment!
review.name: Everglades Expedition

review.reviewBody: If it's been folded up for a while it's kind of hard to unfold and use other than that it's genuine goal zero quality.
review.name: Charges my nomad in about 6 hours!

review.reviewBody: 2nd one in less than one year garbage waste of money
review.name: Don't buy folding solar panels

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping to use this as a maintainer for my boat batteries. There is no way to do this any more since the Guardian device has been discontinued.
This is not a devcice for regular battery charging.it only seems to work with Goal Zero power banks which are not appropriate for typical boat usage.
review.name: Does not charge batteries
comment:
Hello,
You can use the Nomad 20 with the 10 Amp Charger Controller https://www.goalzero.com/products/10a-charge-controller to recharge standard 12V AGM lead acid batteries like a boat battery.

name: Nomad 20 Solar Panel

review.reviewBody:
I almost returned this beanie, because I had used the site filters while hunting for an orange beanie as a gift for my dad, and this one came up in "Cloudberry." It looked mustard yellow to me in the photos though, but I ordered it anyway. Can confirm it's more yellow than orange in person. I ended up keeping it for myself because I liked it so much. It's super comfortable; it's both breathable and warm. It's also got enough material to be rolled up or down to your preference. 

Funny enough, my dad saw me wearing it and made some comments about it. On Xmas day I gave him a different beanie in orange that I had purchased for him, and I told him the story behind the yellow beanie. He asked if he could try it on, and before I knew it he was wearing it all day. I told him to keep it and I ordered a second one for myself.
review.name: Nice beanie

name: Urban Cuff Beanie

review.reviewBody: I have been having a ton of trouble finding ski clothes that fit. Jackets were too baggy and arm length was same regardless of size of jackets leaving me swimming in sleeves. HH seems to generally make smaller clothes. Ordered this item and was a little worried as I saw another review mention the color was not true to the image (aka not grey), but was happily surprised when I opened it. It is a very light mauve/grey/maybe a slight purple to it but great color overall. Anyway, I ordered the XS. I am 5 feet 110 pounds and it fits perfectly. So happy with this purchase!!
review.name: Great for Petite People!

review.itemreviewed: RX801 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing these shoes for a few weeks now and they offer everything I looked for but they don’t feel as wide as I would expect. My running shoes are New Balance EE width so perhaps I expect too much? The closure, Velcro strap and boa are excellent and adjust well. They do look great and I can walk off my bike on any surface, but I would not like to walk far.
review.name: Wide shoes?

review.itemreviewed: RX801 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: As someone with a small but wide foot, it's rare that I find a pair of gravel shoes that fit perfectly right out of the box. Usually, I have to size up to get the fit I want, and then the shoe is sloppy in the heel. Well the RX801R Wide solved that! These things are so comfortable that my first ride in them just so happened to be my longest ride ever. No hot spots, no weird rubbing on the outside of my foot, and best of all no pebbles getting into my shoes. The cleat adjustment range is pretty small compared to a lot of other shoes though, so beware if you're at the extreme ends of your current shoes' adjustment.
review.name: Wide RX801R is a game changer

review.itemreviewed: RX801 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these when the XC902 wide were not available. Sole stiffness is solid but slightly less than the XC902. The one thing about this shoe that bothered me was that the opening for your foot was tight. For a wide shoe it seems like the entry into the shoe would be wide as well. A little snug sliding my foot in with an everyday cycling sock but I could not put my foot in with a woolie boolie sock on with the boa max opened. The toe box also fits slightly narrower than the XC902 and my pinky toe gets slightly squeezed. On the bike they are comfortable and get the pedaling job done. Color is meh....just because someone has wide feet does that relegate them to having to wear boring black shoes all the time?
review.name: Could be better

name: RX801 Wide Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Eagle AXS Rocker Controller Paddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Motions, motor movement much more similar to cable detailer shifting.
review.name: Better

review.reviewBody:
I came from Shimano XTR Di2 electronic shifting. It's obvious why Shimano made their shifters feel familiar, but I always thought Shimano missed an opportunity by creating shifters that mimic cable shifting, I thought Shimano should have taken advantage of the fact that the shifters are just switches and should have created something new. 

Sram took the opposite approach by designing a shifter with little regard for how it feels. The stock rocker is terrible. You either have to change the direction of your thumb 90 degrees for up/down or use the sides of your thumbs. I tried to like it but never did. You can make an accidental shift on a Di2, but you know it because of the tactile feedback. I had so may mis-shifts with Sram that I thought the shifter was broken. I learned that just barely resting your thumb causes shifts that you don't feel. Sram should have designed their new shifter with more travel and tactile feedback. This paddle will not help that, but it makes the shifter acceptable. Sram should have worked with a keyboard company on the switch design and manufacture. In my opinion the shifter/switch design has a lot of room for improvement. There are so may switch technologies available, and Sram could have specified the P1 force (initial press), P2 force (break-over point), and P3 (return force), and travel. I hope that this is an interim fix and that Sram develops a better shifter.
review.name: This helps a lot

name: Eagle AXS Rocker Controller Paddle

review.reviewBody: Absolutely waterproof! Great for off season beach walks or running errands.
review.name: No wet socks here!

review.reviewBody: Liked these boots but both boots cracked on the side within six months of buying them and now leak water. They claim to have a lifetime guarantee but have heard nothing back. Had Xtratuf boots prior to this and they took two days to send me new boots with no receipt needed, and they lasted me a year. If you’re trying to decide between these or Xtratuf .. go for Xtratuf.
review.name: Cracked within 6 months

review.reviewBody: These boots are super well made and are of good quality. I have a problem with the sizing on these boots, due to the opening being a bit too small to be able to just slip these boots on. The size 7 was too small, the size 8 allowed me to slip them on easier but then the foot part was just too big..so I am returning.
review.name: Very well made boots....

review.reviewBody:
I love these not! They are so cute! But I had to send them back. They were a little too snug for me. I'm a small 9 and the 9 was snug on me. Unfortunately, they didn't have a 10 in the dark green which I loved but I think those would have been perfect.
Quality of the boot is amazing! Would but again in my size!
review.name: Love the dark green

review.reviewBody: I love the wide toe box, especially compared to other rubber boots out there. Super grippy bottoms for wet conditions. And I love the color!
review.name: Wider toe box!

review.reviewBody: Really cute and comfy. Good price. Decided to switch from Xtra tuffs after my last pair of deck boots cracked and started leaking after just a year Time will tell
review.name: Convert from Xtra Tuff deck boots.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So comfortable for the boat, around the house, hunting, and keeps your feet dry and warm
review.name: Easy slip on boots with awesome comfort!

review.reviewBody: They are great and fit perfect. Love how comfortable they are!
review.name: work boots

review.reviewBody: Love the new style and colors are great too. Can wear them all day on the boat.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Love these boots!  I purchased the tea duck camo ankle boots.  They fit true to size, easy to slip on and off and are the MOST COMFORTABLE boots/shoes I own!!!
review.name: Best Ankle Boot I Have Purchased

name: Deck Boss Ankle Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I like this shirt although the color was off from the picture.
It is black and a dark gray.   Just wish the gray was lighter.
review.name: Nice weight

review.reviewBody: I bought this last month and am so in love with the quality and fit. I'm 5'7 165 lbs and bought a large because I wasn't sure if it would cling to my body and wanted it to cover my back area. The fit is perfect! I could have probably sized down to a medium and would be happy, but still glad I bought the large. This is a must buy!

review.reviewBody: I love the Kavu Skylar shirt, so I get another one whenever a new print/pattern becomes available. Unfortunately the one pictured online is not the one that was shipped to me. I already own the one that was shipped, so now I have to return the one Backcountry shipped me. Disappointed that the wrong image is featured on Backcountry’s website because returning stuff is a time suck.
review.name: Wrong Print is Shown Online

review.reviewBody: I like this shirt. Wouldn't say I love it, but it fits me bigger than expected. I would say it runs slightly big. I was a little disappointed that way, but I am a small framed person and that is my life story. It fits me more like a tunic than a shirt.
review.name: Longer than expected

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: So warm! I ordered Small anticipating to wear layers underneath, but it was too big and gapped in the chest and armpit area. I should have gotten the XS like the one I lost, but they sold out.
review.name: So WARM, but too big

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Going to Norway in late May to hike and bought this after much time spent looking at reviews. It seems very warm considering it’s weight. My husband also bought one and he agrees. I will still layer, but this jacket will keep me warm with minimum layers.
review.name: Warm for the Weight

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the style details ( zippers and cut / fit) but most of all this is SO WARM!!!! Standing outside in the dark cheering on skiers and I’m toasty.
review.name: SO WARM

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Received the Fitzroy hoodie today. I’m 95lbs with muscular arms and a long waist. The XS is comfortable. The jacket is super cozy and seems it will go with just about anything. I live in a town where I do most things on foot, so the pockets are awesome. I look forward to enjoying the jacket for the rest of the winter, and years to come. Thanks to Backcountry for always carrying the best gear!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I also noticed a few weeks of wearing it that the feathers are coming out everywhere! Please do your research! It’s not worth $400. It looks and feels good but it must have a defective material in it/- I’m thinking the outer “recycled” covering isn’t good.
review.name: Leaks feathers!

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
It's *almost* too warm (but I run hot, so take that with a grain of salt). 

It's INCREDIBLY comfortable. Great fit. VERY LIGHT for its size and warmth. (Makes it a great multi-purpose coat for travel in the winter, too). 

Very happy to see some extended sizes offered. (The XL would probably fit, but I appreciate something that gives my hips more room to breath.) 

I have been wearing it around town, but fully expect it will be invaluable for cold-nights while desert camping, and hut/yurt trips. 

I can verify it properly sheds water in some light rain. 

The only small complaint I have is that I've already seen a couple feathers poking out some seams.
review.name: Frickin' Warm

review.itemreviewed: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket and I was extremely excited. It was warm and actually very flattering. After around a couple of weeks of use, it seemed the filling in the sleeves was completely gone and flat, so it didn't keep me warm at all. I feel $400 should provide a jacket that doesn't fall apart after a couple of weeks.  I hope it was just the jacket I received, but I was very disappointed.
review.name: Defective product?

name: Fitz Roy Down Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: This was an impulse purchase as I was rounding out my cart. I like that the volume of the bag doesn't change as you go through your clothing. The material itself appears to be of good quality but I've only used it a couple of times so I can't comment on it's durability.
review.name: A Great Idea

review.reviewBody: Bike Packing In an effort to try out bike packing without paying big bucks, I stumbled upon a sale for these dry bags. They work perfectly. I might eventually upgrade to bike packing bags, but these dry bags have suited me just fine. Thin but durable material, and quality buckles. I have not tested them out in rain or any kind of water, but they keep out the dust.
review.name: For The Love Of...

review.reviewBody: This stuff sack works like a charm.... Simple and effective at keeping the stinky stuff away from the fresh stuff.
review.name: Dirty socks on lockdown.

review.reviewBody: So convenient having separate compartments in the same bag! I used to take a stuff sack for dirty clothes, now I only have to open the opposite end of the same bag. I just took a four day trip and everything fit in the 15L. It's easy to tell the different sides: One says "Wear Me" and has a black clip, the other says "Wash Me" and has a gray clip.
review.name: Perfect travel companion

review.reviewBody: What a great idea! Love it and bring it everywhere!
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: I use this daily to bring clothes to and from work on my bicycle commute. Nice to have two separate containers if something is contaminated or wet. The straps help compress the bag and contents so it fits in my backpack. I can easily fit a pair of pants with belt, underwear, socks, a shirt, and dress shirt in one side of the bag and probably have room for more on the other side. I will definitely be bringing this on any out of town trip in my luggage. No more sniff testing!
review.name: End of the sniff test

review.reviewBody: This is a brilliant design. Great quality, great material. My only frustration is that they are often sold out and there are few colour choices. I would love to add a couple more to my kit to separate base layers, rain gear etc.
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Awesome bag for keeping my dirty and clean clothes organized. The 15L is the perfect size for a mountain bike/camping weekend.
review.name: Nice to have for staying organized

review.reviewBody: Haven't used this out on the trail yet, just used for a weekend trip and was great. Keeps my bag organized.
review.name: Great bag for camping trips

review.reviewBody: My daughter loved using this product to separate her contaminated hospital clothes from her clean clothes.
review.name: Love this product and it helps make work easier

name: Dirty/Clean 15L Bag

review.name: Great ski pole for everything a skier needs.

review.reviewBody: Nice poles.    Light, rugged.    I like the lack of straps, quick clip in and out.    Highly recommend.
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: I'm a great fan of Leki poles and these do not disappoint.. Light, strong and well balanced. Add some Leki gloves and you have a perfect combo.
review.name: Excellent poles

review.reviewBody: Looking for Leki poles 2 inches shorter than my current Leki poles. These fit my needs (pun intended).  I like the larger “release mechanism” in this version of ski pole.  Easier to disengage. I did shave off a bit of the hook - too wide - to accommodate the loop system of my gloves and mittens.  Now it’s an easy ‘snap’ in place.
review.name: Consistent Leki Product.

review.reviewBody: My second Spitfire set.  Very satisfied with the purchase.
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: Picked up my first pair of Leki poles this season and they were awesome. I ended up choosing the Spitfire 3D poles for the features and style, really like the multi-directional trigger grips as it makes it super easy to clip in or unclip when needed. The mesh frame strap was easy to fit and adjust to my gloves. The poles are light and well balanced. Would definitely recommend the Spitfire 3D poles, the quick release triggers are a major upgrade from poles with straps.
review.name: Spitfire 3D Ski Poles

name: Spitfire 3D Ski Poles

review.reviewBody:
I'm 6'0", 150 lbs with a 29" waist and the small fit great on me. 

Pros: Feels durable and well-built. Material is comfortable with stretch, but feels rugged and like it will last a while. Look great and are the perfect length for shorts in 2023. I could totally wear them from the beach or a trail and would not feel out of place wearing them in public afterwards.

Cons: Minor "swishing" sound while walking, but not bad enough to not wear them around. The "Slate" color I got isn't super versatile, but looks good with darker colored shirts. Wouldn't be my first choice for a hike on a hot day since they're not as breathable as a lightweight running short, but I don't think that's what they're made for.
review.name: Solid Do-It-All shorts

review.reviewBody: 5’ 3” and 120 lbs, if that helps anyone. Perfect fit.
review.name: Matches my jacket by same company.

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly, never can be sure when purchasing online…
review.name: Fits perfectly

review.reviewBody: I want to live in this vest! As soon as I put it in, it feels like it's emitting heat and warmth! Soft, cozy, with fleece-lined hand pockets, and arm holes that do not feel constricting or ride up too high. I want to buy every single one of these vests!!
review.name: Feels like it's heated

review.reviewBody: These vests have a great design. They are longish, tapered in just the right places, and warm. This is my 2nd outdoor research vest and also have multiple OT jackets both for spring and winter. Love the quality that each affords us. This is definitely a case of, "you get what you play for".
review.name: My 2nd OT vest

review.reviewBody: For the past year or so, I've been continually stealing my husband's helium down vest, but not wanting to get my own because I didn't want to look nerdy wearing a vest outside the house... I finally broke down and bought one, and I couldn't be happier. So far its biggest adventure has been to the dog park, but it's held up well to being jumped on and pawed at, so I think durability is pretty good. Love the fit as well, body following without being too tight. XS, 5'4", 115lb
review.name: Never thought I'd buy a vest

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my petite (5'2") mother. Got a size M and it fits great. The tapered cut is really flattering and the M still allows space for layering without it being bulky or heavy. The length fit her well as it was not cropped but also not really long.
review.name: Not Too Puffy Puffer

review.reviewBody: We keep a cool house and this vest is perfect for keeping me warm. I do wish the fabric were not as shiny, but it packs so light and fits well under any jacket, it's hard to complain about such a small aesthetic detail!
review.name: Perfect Cozy layer

review.reviewBody: I was excited to try this vest because I work outside. Sadly it was too small and short. PROS: It was very warm. If I wear it zipped it will not go over my hips and butt at all which makes me think it is not a true "womens" cut. If I wear it where it should lay it is not big enough to zip. I will be returning this, sadly.
review.name: Runs small and short

review.reviewBody: This vest is very comfortable, warm, and packable. I love the toggle at the bottom hem to dial in the fit and better contain body heat. Bought it in black. Would definitely buy another one -- and much more Outdoor Research in general -- if there were more colors I like. I prefer brighter, more fun colors (emerald/jade, fuchsia, sapphire blue, etc.).
review.name: comfortable and warm

review.reviewBody: This is by far her favorite piece of winter clothing. Very light, very warm and very soft. Pockets are perfect too.
review.name: She won't take it off!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit UltraLight SI Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I needed an affordable pad to fit inside my sleeping bag for hammock camping on the now and affordable.  I'm 5'5" and this went into my small sized mummy bag perfect.  Combined with my down fill 20 degree Kelty I stayed warm wearing a base layer at 39 degrees.  I had a little of that shoulder/side arm hammock chill but the rest of me was toasty warm.  I saw the one star review stating the stuff sack was too small and made it my mission to prove them wrong,  because of that I had it rolled so tight it went in the bag with room to spare.  So if you actually take the time to roll it right, the stuff sack is perfect.  I like to keep my volume as low as possible so I'm pleased with this unit.
review.name: Suits my needs

review.reviewBody:
I wish I can love it, but it came with the security tag. I went to a department to try and get it removed and they couldn't do it. The guy literally said, where was this from and that in California they didn't have that strong of magnets?? So now I am watching countless Youtube videos to figure out how to remove it. I've already made some small holes in the bag trying to break it.
Other than this issue, the pad seems great, easy to roll up and perfect for my size. I'm excited to use it for camping.
review.name: Came with security tag

review.reviewBody: Typical corporation to save pennies rather than make a stuff sack that works. Gave up after 15 minutes.
review.name: Score is based on stuff sack

review.reviewBody:
I bought this thing for bike touring. My first our out with it was amazing. The first night I stealth camped and ended up in a clearing with tons of thick vines and roots. This thing was so comfortable even on all those roots. The next night, I was in down town buffalo, and could only crash in a friends back yard due to the pandemic. The yard was just fenced in concrete. This pad again did the trick. i could hardly tell i was on cement. 

The only recommendation i have is to get a dry sack. Sleeve it comes with is great, but i rode 6 hours in a thunderstorm, so some water was able to leak in. 

Other than that, great purchase.
review.name: Small pad mega comfort

name: UltraLight SI Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: I received this cable knit sweater a week or so ago and it actually had a hole big enough to put your fist through other left arm and a smaller hole in the right shoulder.  Customer service told me none of their clothing was inspected orior to shipping and was rude on top of the situation.  Very disappointed with this entire experience and it’s very unfortunate!
review.name: Backcountry isn’t what it used to be!

review.reviewBody: Like all Hestra gloves and mittens, and I own four different pairs now, these are first rate in terms of warmth and dexterity.
review.name: Hestra guide glove review

review.reviewBody: I have worn Hestra gloves for years.  They have worn extremely well and I have three models including the Falt Guide Glove.  I bought this glove for bushcraft and have been using it in Colorado for snowshoeing, bushcraft, and skiing.  They are super in all conditions above 10F.  Super fit. Super liners. Amazing leather. Well worth the money.
review.name: Fantastic gloves!

review.reviewBody:
The leather outer of this glove is excellent, with high quality and soft leather.  The cuff is also a good length if you want some wrist/jacket coverage but don't want the bulk of a full powder cuff.  Having a removable liner is a great versatility feature, and it allows you to dry both the leather shell and liner much faster.  That's important for a non-waterproof glove.

This glove falls short in its liner, where quality is an issue.  The first pair I received had a large hole in the liner by the index fingertip.  Backcountry gladly replaced them, but the second pair also had a small hole in the palm (see pic).  I emailed Hestra, and they refused to exchange for a different liner despite the repeat issues on brand new products.  

One other nice to have feature at this price would be handcuffs/wrist straps.

Sizing runs small, consistent with my other Hestra products.  Order a size up if on the fence.
review.name: Good Glove/Bad Liner & No Handcuffs

review.reviewBody: After reading many stellar reviews online, I was super excited when I first received these gloves. However, the leather was already tearing after taking these gloves on a single ski day at the resort. Unfortunately, Hestra refuses to replace the gloves under warranty. So now I'm stuck with $185 gloves that are falling apart faster than my $40 Burton's. These gloves are not warm or durable. Hestra likely has changed its materials or manufacturing.
review.name: NEW VERSION IS LOWER QUALITY

review.reviewBody:
After using these as my primary ski gloves for 40+ days last season, I have been very happy and found these to be worth the higher cost.  

Initially, I worried I'd gotten a size too small, but after several days of use they broke in and now fit me perfectly.  With proper care (drying after use, regular leather conditioning) I can see these lasting me a LONG time as a ski glove.  The wool liners are warm and easy to remove for drying.  I had cold hands once all season, and it was -20 F with windchill, no handwarmers.  Beyond that these were toasty and super durable, and also look great. 

My only recommendation would be for anyone who wants to use an additional glove liner to size up at least a size if not two.  They are a snug fit even after breaking in.
review.name: Great Glove After Break-In

review.reviewBody:
I have two pair ? one bought ten years ago, and one bought last season (with a PSIA discount). The old pair has a tiny tear in the gauntlet where there must have been a fault in the leather, but the seams are tight and perfect, palms and fingers are intact. I use it as an all-round work glove, now (stacking wood, snow blowing, shoveling) and for hiking in the winter woods ? it should last many years still. The newer pair I ski in. They're warm for a glove; My hands run cold, but these were fine in the teens and below, with a hand warmer stuffed in (no hand warmer pocket, btw). 

I have a normal palm with shortish fingers; size 8 is perfect for me (they call it a "large," but . . .) Did I mention you can replace the liners indefinitely?

I'd buy them again, but unfortunately (!) they seem not to wear out, a beautiful, hard-wearing, high-quality glove. Some expensive things are worth the money.
review.name: Worth the Price

review.reviewBody: I am always hesitant to purchase high ticket items. (this may not be high ticket gloves to some people) I did a lot of research, as everyone should do, and came across Hestra. Finally, I settled on the Falt Guide Glove due to its versitile nature. I bought these in Feb. 2019 and haven't had to deal with cold numb hands since. They are rugged and haven't shown much abrasion at all from winter backpacking and snowboarding usage.
review.name: Money Well Spent

name: Falt Guide Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit ALTO TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ALTO TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit ALTO TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Alto TR1 after having a disastrous experience with the MSR Freelite 1. The Alto provides superior shoulder and headroom, with a well placed door. Its super easy to pitch, and the little triangular space that pops out on the otherwise rectangular floor space makes the tent feel roomier, and provides space for my dog or gear. The vestibule is large and the ventilation, overall, with the fly closed, is pretty good. I bikepacked in below freezing overnight temperatures, and there was a bit of condensation at the foot of the tent, and overhead - even with the peak vents open and the cover unzipped. However, somecondensation is always expected when there is ice on the outside of the fly. 🥶
I highly recommend this tent for anyone looking to lighten their load backpacking or bikepacking. The tubular storage pack strapped down nicely on top of my handlebar dry bag. Well done, S2S!
review.name: Well designed and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent almost 2 years ago, and am not mad about this purchase. Over the couple years I've owned it, I've used it 10-15 times maybe more not sure. So far it has held up very well. I like how it has three different bags one for tent, fly, and poles. This allows for packing it separate in your pack, or between two packs. You also have the option to connect the pole bag to the fly and tent bag to make it on unit vs three. Also these bags also can serve a purpose inside you tent as gear holders and the pole bag as a lantern which is cool that they have more than one use. However the lantern is a joke as it's hard to snap on and comes off easily, so a good idea just needs some improvement. I found when I first bought my tent that it was hard to pack up as I was folding it up, and then it was extremely difficult to get into the bag, same with the fly. After a few times I started just stuffing in into the bag like a stuff sack, works way better and can have it all packed in minutes. Another thing I love is I was on an overnight backing trip by the coast, and during the night it started to rain and continued till mid morning. I was able to take down my tent and pack it up and fold up my footprint all under the fly. After my pack was pretty much ready to go, still under the fly where it was dry, I then took down my fly and poles packed that and hit the trail! I did get a 2 person mostly to use as a one person and have plenty of room, but have once used it with one of my friends which was pretty tight. So don't highly recommend sleeping two unless you’re comfortable sleeping really close together. There is room for a backpack and some gear under each vestibule so completely doable. All and all I really like this tent it's versatile, practical, and light.
review.name: Love my Alto TR2!

review.reviewBody:
I finally took this tent out on its first trip last weekend. Pros: it is very lightweight and packs down tiny, can be set up quickly (once you practice it, it is not the most intuitive tent I've set up), and reflectors on the rainfly make it easy to see at night. Cons: it is so small - my significant other and I both have regular-width sleeping pads (20") and they take up the entire tent floor. You would not be able to fit anything wider than that. I would only plan on using this as a 1 person tent unless you are very friendly with your tent partner. We could not fit any gear inside the tent which was a big drawback for us. Because the tent is so light, it also feels kind of flimsy. I'm hoping that durability won't be an issue going forward.

I'm neutral on the light bar. It's an interesting idea and it does work but I wouldn't say that is a necessity by any means.
review.name: Light but SMALL

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very professional but also gave me personal service like I was their only customer
review.name: Very professional but also gave

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy set up and absolutely bug proof. Camping in North Florida for three nights was a breeze. Totally dry in a couple of downpours. Very pleased with the experience.
review.name: Easy set up and absolutely

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the tent. So well thought out. Genius really!
review.name: I love the tent. So

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As an adventure guide I work with LOTS of equipment - from rock, tree and ice climbing, to caving, mountain biking, wilderness survival - I am constantly looking for the best gear to make my outdoor adventures enjoyable, both for my clients and for myself. When it comes to overnight and multi-day programming, I have gone through nearly a dozen tents over the past 20 years. Generally my go to brand for personal use has been Big Agnes. Until I tried the Sea to Summit Alto TR2. The Alto TR2 is easy to set up, works great for star gazing on clear nights, and provides plenty of weather proofing for rain and wind. As a semi-free standing tent, it is easy to move around when trying to find the optimal footprint, and set-up and take down is a breeze. The double-door vestibules mean I can store things outside of the tent and still keep them dry, or even cook over a stove if it is really pouring out. The light tube is a bonus for diffusing my headlamp light when getting ready for bed, and the unique 3 bag storage system allows me to stow gear in multiple packs or multiple places in my own backpack. This is a great help when I have to make room in my pack for carrying equipment for a tired client on a long hike. Although I currently have 6 other tents to choose from, I find myself reaching for the Alto TR2 every time.
review.name: Best Tent I Own

review.reviewBody:
The tent structure is sufficiently spacious, but it still feels small for two people. You can barely fit both person’s backpack in the tent. It’s just enough room for two sleeping mats. 

The light bar, as another mentioned, is unnecessary as most lanterns only require a loop to clip on. There’s one tiny loop at the center of the ceiling and it’s likely not designed for hanging your typical LED small lanterns. The light bar also only clips on via plastic snaps, so it won’t hold much but a headlamp, anyway. I can’t stand it. Mostly, it’s because it’s really difficult to pack it into two awkwardly designed bucket bags when they are both fully packed. 

I went out camping at a very dry, hot climate environment and there were a lot of spiky objects on the ground. When I entered my tent, I couldn’t even put my knee on the tent floor because the spikes kept poking through the floor despite crushing the whole ground free of spikes prior to set-up. When I got home, the thin tent floor was covered in those spiky objects. The tent floor is ridiculously thin so I have to get the tent footprint. 

Lastly, I don’t understand why the pouches are designed so snug. I spent 15 mins just trying to push both the fly and the tent itself into both pouches while the rest of my friends had packed up into the car already. I was left alone for 20 mins trying to pack my tent. Also can’t stand that there are 3 pieces of components when they’re all packed up. They’re not held very well and if the two straps are not tightened, they will come apart. 

Sorry for the rant. I’m just a bit frustrated at what STS sacrificed for weight and not for durability. I have a mild form of trauma from entering my tent now that I realize how paper-thin the floor is. I also don’t know where to put my lantern since it won’t fit through the light bar. Even if it did, it’ll probably collapse on me due to the weight. 

Thanks for reading. Hope this helped.
review.name: Great tent, if you’re camping at home, perhaps

review.reviewBody:
This tent is an excellent, lightweight, alpine back packing tent! Especially for climbers out there who are going up into the alpine with a partner - the way this tent packs away is super convenient in that the tent, fly, and the poles are all packed into their own bags so you can split up the weight across you and your partner while approaching!  Who ever has to carry that little bit of extra weight get to only carry 1 of the 3. 

Reasonably high head room and roomy enough to spend a day waiting out a storm, i've been impressed at how well this tent holds up and its ease of set up and take down.
review.name: Big fan of this tent!

review.reviewBody:
Overall this tent is fine. It's easy to set up and take down, the quality of the components is really nice and feels pretty solid. I do like that it's almost entirely mesh on the body which allows for great views from inside as well as great airflow. 

For backpackers I'm sure being able to split the components between packs is a welcome feature. There's also ample space to stuff your gear, and you can turn the little stuff sacks the tent goes in into more gear pockets. The instructions for setup are right on the gear itself so you don't have to worry about losing it or trying to figure it out as you go along. Although as I said, setting it up is super easy as there's only one pole and the stretch points are color-coded. 

I wouldn't use this as an actual 2-person tent unless you like cuddling with your travel partner, but it's perfect for one person. I can't imagine that two sleeping pads would fit together well at the foot of the tent without overlapping or pushing up against the walls of the tent but the really depends on your gear choices. 

I wish the poles were just a bit shorter so I could fit them more easily into my motorcycle's panniers. They only fit in the middle my top case which means I have to sort of tetris other things around them. 

Here's the catch: I have only used this tent twice, but on one such occasion it rained throughout the night. Nothing too heavy, but it was constant. I woke up the next morning to find that the water had soaked through the toggles you use to hold the vestibule doors open and dripped onto me and my sleeping bag. For a $500 tent that claims to be 3-season, this is unacceptable. This is definitely something that should be reconsidered or redesigned in some way. 

This tent also does not come with a footprint. The material at the bottom of the tent seems pretty solid though, so it's not much of a loss and some backpackers may even like the weight reduction. I think for the price it should still be included but maybe that's just me. 

I feel like I could have purchased a truly waterproof 4-season tent for much less. I'm going to manually do some waterproofing and give it a few more tries, but as it stands now the pros don't outweigh the cons.
review.name: Easy to use, light weight, cool design, but NOT waterproof!

name: ALTO TR2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: just used it with my partner on a 3 week car and hiking trip around the european alps. What you expect, material wise, from a lightweight tent, so you have to be gentle. But the weight and volume for a 3p tent is pretty legit. I'd say that if youre reluctant to buy a 600$ MSR tent, give this one a try and enjoy the price and space of a 3p tent. Could use a couple more pockets inside but enough to work with,

description: Buy the Blackburn Plugger Tubeless Repair Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Plugger Tubeless Repair Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Plugger Tubeless Repair Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: First off, I'm using this for my road bike, so invariably need higher psi than a mtb repair. I hit a rock today on a park road 30 km from home and got a nice but small hole a third of the way from the center of the tread towards the rim. Pulled out this tool for the first time and the plugs were so firmly glued to their plastic backing that I couldn't remove them intact. Finally cobbled together a decent facsimile of a plug out of two of them, long story shorter, it didn't hold air for even a minute. Can't say it would have worked better if the plugs could have been removed intact, but it was a long walk for me to get home.
review.name: High hopes dashed

review.reviewBody: Blackburn isn't often first to market with kit, but what they do come out with tends to work well and at a consumer favorable price.  This is no different.  Its got all you need for those tire tears and pinch flat repairs needing 'bacon'.  It's mostly plastic construction which no doubt helps with the price point.  That said, its a little larger than my dynaplug kit with its CNC machined case/tool--but that comes at 3 times the price.
review.name: small, lightweight and priced right

name: Plugger Tubeless Repair Kit

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: I have had these for about 3 years.  They are light comfy, easy to enter and initially great for uphill.  Soon enough the heel cup around the ankle bones developed issues with excruciating pain.  Some dude on YouTube has a video of how to resolve it with a heat gun and clamps but who wants to have to do that.  It did fix my pain issue btw.  They just aren't very still.  I would compare them to a 80 flex alpine boot.  That's why the new radical pro boot has a different front tongue they realized the hoji free just was not stiff enough.   I am replacing them this year with the Tigard 130 which looks way more like a traditional alpine boot.  I am usually 29.5 in a ski boot, I think I might have been able to get away with a 28.5.  The current price might be worth checking these out now.  When I bought them they were around 700 bones.
review.name: Not 130 flex.  Issues with pain

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
I've been on these for the past two seasons. I use them for everything: in bounds, touring, jumps, pillows. These boots are the ONE solution.
The tour/walk range combined with downhill performance is unmatched. I use these in both pin and alpine bindings. I'm going to grab a 2nd set to keep the dream alive!
review.name: the ONE

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
These boots look great out of the box, and I wanted so bad for them to work.  And the fit around my foot was great.

BUT, they have a unique design…they taper significantly from the foot to the ankle.  And there just wasn’t enough room around my ankle.  The boots were actually painful to pull into and painful to stand in…no way I could imagine skiing in them.  There also was uncomfortable pressure on the inside of my ankle just standing in the shell without the liner.

And I feel like I have ankles more on the skinny side.

Another but, though.  Everyone is built differently, and they might work for you.  They really are nice boots, and I liked the walking mechanism better than any touring boot I’ve tried.
review.name: Agree with Don?t Buy Above

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: I'm 5'11" 170# and a ski instructor.  I've skied these boots for nearly three seasons mostly in the backcountry with about 10 days in bounds.  This boot tours very well.  I noticed right away that I had more energy and I was willing to go further compared to the boots I had previously.  The Sidas liner that comes in them is garbage in my opinion.  I tried skiing it for a while without satisfaction. I switched  to an Intuition which saves weight, improves fit, improves skiing, and the Intuition is warmer.  I really like how easy it is to switch from tour to ski mode but the integration of the strap makes it really hard to add a booster strap which I think would improve the flex pattern.  Overall it's a nice boot especially once you swap the liners.
review.name: Better than average

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: these are great fro nordic skiing and ski touring in alaska where the possiblity of blowing snow and high wind is very high. these full featured goggles keep snow and other debris out of your eyes when vision is crucial. the s1-s2 lenes are great for adjusting to changing light conditions and helps keep you on your toes in the backcountry.
review.name: great in all conditions

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
This boot is so nice to look at and very well made -buckles work perfect and the release is smooth.  That said they are the most uncomfortable boots I have ever owned.  They feel great stand in and hanging around. Then once you put them to use it?s all down hill. 

Left ankle rub not to a blister but an uncomfortable pressure 

Right top of foot super uncomfortable like it?s squeezing my foot overall not comfortable 

Left top of foot uncomfortable like it?s squeezing my foot on top.  

No blisters - once I put the boots on it?s good then about 30min in it?s like hell - then I overcome it mentally and deal for the day - then when I see the trail head it?s like hell again.

Take the boot off and all is good - happy feet with no pain or problems post tour. 

It?s like a pain ghost in the boot - my foot is totally cool in my alpine Lange boots. Happy as a can be.

I had them heat fitted at the alpiner in CB - that made zero difference. 

I have 6 tours on them and 6 days at the resort same results touring or alpine. 

The liner is thin so that may be the issue - not sure.

Bottom line save yourself and don?t buy them the return policy did not give me the time need to work out if adjustments would help or if was a bad design. I can confirm it?s a bad design. 

They will be on eBay soon.
review.name: Don?t Buy

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody: Nice and snug fit. Incredible comfort and range of motion uphill. Ideal stiffness and forward lean for the downhill. The liner is a bit thin but is comfy.

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
These boots are not a hard charging boot.  I ski 70-80 days a year and have about 10 days in these boots.  I've skied them on groomers, crud and pow.  I think they'll work fine for touring and skiing pow but would not recommend them as a do-it-all boot.
The biggest problem is they have lateral flex.  When trying to lay down hard carving turns I could feel the boot flex to the sides and was worried about breaking my ankle. This might be less of an issue on skis narrower underfoot but over 110 it's an problem.
The liner is also flimsy and cheap.  I had to swap the liner for an intuition that kept my ankles from banging the shell which relieved some of the other pressure points.  The intuition liner also helped firm up the lateral flex in the boot but not enough to stop it entirely.
Within a week of use, one of the pieces broke on the power strap.  I had to rig something up for the boot to continue functioning as expected.
review.name: Soft boots

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
Past boots in recent years include: Lange Freeride Pro, Dalbello Lupo 130c, Fischer Ranger 13.
I grew up racing and competing moguls in New Hampshire, but have lived in WY and CO skiing 80%+ backcountry since 2004. I love pillows, technical airs, deep pow, and aesthetic couloirs. I still bang out a few resort laps in here and there too, so it's worth having a tongue for standard alpine binders. The video posted with this review just shows off my style, not this boot.
The Hoji Pro is by far the best boot I've ever had. Somehow it's both the stiffest and lightest I've experienced. The walk mode is pure magic.
I was warned of a backseat stance (usually fixable with shims/spoilers) and a short cuff concerned me. Neither of these are any issue for me. I feel solid and nimble even skiing resort hardpack.
Pure stoke for this boot!
review.name: Believe the hype

review.itemreviewed: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023
review.reviewBody:
After an initial adjustment period to a more upright and balanced stance, with the right ski combination (stiff, full rocker aka Renegade ) ripping around on anything (except actual icy chutes, even icy bumps are handleable) has ben fantastic.
 
Overall this boot has been fantastic and well worth the effort  to dial in the fit.  

Pro Tip: If you are having medial malleolus pain (inside ankle) or other ankle pain, check the boot fitter you are working with knows the trick to open up the lower shell around that area.  Applying expert use of a heat gun, it takes 5-15 minutes.

name: Hoji Free Alpine Touring Ski Boot - 2023

review.reviewBody:
I'd been curious about Norda's for a while, and finally pulled the trigger on a pair of these. I live in Maine and run snowy/icy dirt roads and trails all winter.

I love almost everything about these, and they come close to justifying the price. 

The one big issue I'm having is the heel cup. I've run about 20 miles in them so far, and it's rubbing enough to cause blisters. There's no stitching anywhere else except for directly down the back of the heel.

I'm hoping some adjustments with lacing and insoles will help, but really disappointed that a premium shoe like this would have such a poorly designed heel. 

I'd give them 5 stars if this wasn't a problem, but what's the point of a running shoe you can't run in?
review.name: Almost Perfect, One Fatal Flaw

name: 001 G+ Spike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Best climbing shoes, quality, comfort
review.name: I love my testarosa

review.reviewBody: It's amazing to see people complain about the Ferrari of climbing shoes because they're "too narrow." Climbing shoes are shoes and not meant to fit everyone the same, so to discredit such an amazing product for the aforementioned is ludicrous. These shoes are amazing and will be great for most seasoned climbers.
review.name: Disregard Negative Reviews

review.reviewBody: I have two pairs of old Testarossa, they fit really well for my wide fore feet. I use them for my projects and hardcore, I am confident when using them. Now they changed and I have to return the shoes.
review.name: too narrow to wear the new designed shoe

review.reviewBody: I have 3 pairs and am about to buy the 4th. There's lots of good shoes out there, but this is my go to.
review.name: Just works better than anything else

review.reviewBody: I liked old Testarossa shoes a lot. They were quite sensitive and extremely comfortable for the aggressive equipment. The question who and why decided ""to modify" them is painful point of the last year of mine. The updated model has less informative toe, unnecessary excessive hardness of sole due to odd bulge and weird loooong laces that can be easily stepped on during your climbing. Finally it seems weird in contrast with previous version. Some my friends with Testarossa additction have migrated to sc**pa camp now and I'm seriously pondering what can be replacement. It would be great if old version were preserved (like miura) but seemingly it contradicts with marketer's dream about yearly bonus. But, to be honest, he/she needs to be fired.
review.name: The new version is awful

review.reviewBody:
After owning 4 pairs of solutions, I decided to give another Sportiva shoe a go, and boy am I glad I did. The updated Testarossa's have provided everything that I am looking for. The shoe itself broke in within just a few pitches, with the lacing system providing the perfect fit to my feet. 

As a climber that prefers overhung precision climbing, I truly couldn't have asked for a better shoe. On routes with small edges I have found the pointy toe to provide excellent contact and power. I have also found it's updated heel cup to provided great performance while heel hooking on multiple types of rock. 

If you are looking for a great all around shoe to send your dream project, you really need to look no further.
review.name: Superior Sending Shoe

review.reviewBody: I'm 42.5 in Solutions, the 42 fits perfectly.  Torture devices for the first few routes and maybe even sessions, but I wouldn't go any bigger.   Precise, good edging shoes, and they look nice.  I wouldn't say i'm "blown away" by their quality compared to previous shoes I've owned, but I also don't find any fault with them. Five stars. For reference I'm usually size 11 in street shoe.
review.name: Sized 1/2 down from solutions

review.reviewBody: If you like the old Testarossas then you will like these even more. The new improved heel is a big step up and completes this already great shoe. These shoes edge when you need them to and smear really well even though they are downturned.
review.name: The new Testarossa

review.reviewBody:
La Sportiva Testarossa Original Style
I have had my trusty pair of Testarossas off and on for six years now with a couple of resoles and they have been almost the only shoe I ever reach for.  From burly boulders and steep sport on sandstone in Arkansas to technical edging and balancing on faces in the Front Range, and always trusty for anything the setters have to throw at me in the gym.  These are my go to, do it all, one stop shop of a shoe.  The asymmetrical lacing and combination of leather and synthetic uppers have made a perfect fitting shoe, that even when I have sized it aggressively has remained comfortable for long routes and multiple laps in the gym.  But even better is that even when sized more comfortably they have preformed just as aggressively.  The only tweek to the shoe that I would have ever asked for is in the heel; it fits securely but always feels a little thin on heel hooks.  I am very excited to see the remodel this year with the redesigned heel, and hopefully get a chance to try them out soon and explore the new heel!
review.name: Only shoe you ever need!

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair.  Fantastic shoe, my favorite.
review.name: My fav!

name: Testarossa Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: Grabbed for my 17 year old brother in law and he loved it. The mix of colors was perfect and hit different. Also caught it on sale for 160 down from 350 so a win win.
review.name: Great Sale & Purchase

review.reviewBody: This North Face jacket is warm, and perfect for all weather. Fits well, looks stylish, and is super durable. Worth every penny!
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'7, 41.25 inch chest, 32 inch waist. Jacket runs true to size. I am wearing a t-shirt and sweat shirt and the jacket fits perfectly over them. I have 2 inches of material over my waistline, so jacket definitely runs short but is perfectly sized for me. This is a relaxed fit so I have about 4 inches + of excess material around the waist if I pull the jacket tight in the waist area.
 Material is incredibly light weight, mobility is perfect, material breathes so you shouldn't sweat much. Jacket would be excellent for hiking in cold weather, skiing or a multitude of other things. Black could be worn almost anywhere for a casual night out. NF please bring back the fleece t-shirts in this sizing!
review.name: Finally a jacket for shorter people

review.reviewBody: The quality of the product is excellent. However, ordering online was not a good experience as the item was larger than the measurements listed on the page. On the positive side, the shipping was faster than I expected. However, the return process was stressful. It took a few weeks after I returned the item to receive the refund.
review.name: Excellent product with bad experience during return process

review.reviewBody: This Nuptse is probably the fourth one I've owned over the years. Such a great jacket. It fits well, and it keeps me warm. It also looks awesome. So puffy. Maybe I'll get another color just for the heck of it this winter.
review.name: Down done the right way

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for in a winter jacket. The fit is perfect. It is warm and comfortable and I get lots of compliments on it. The whole family is outfitted with this outstanding cold weather jacket.
review.name: Best cold weather jacket!

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit. Brought this coat for my son who is 13 yrs old, Men's XS. Bright color, excellent quality.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Great Jacket!! So happy to see this retro North Face jacket come back. Light weight, comfortable, and warm. I've received many positive comments from people!! (I got the gold and black version)
review.name: Highly recommend!!

review.reviewBody: This is the second Retro Nuptse Jacket I purchased but in a different color. We do not want any other jackets in my household. Super warm yet light and very stylish. Love it!
review.name: I would buy this product again and my family already has two

review.reviewBody: I own 3 Neptuse Coats. The price on this one was a steal. I think this is the 2nd one I got from Backcountry
review.name: I have 3 of these

name: 1996 Retro Nuptse Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a low profile liner to wear with pants, and these are awesome. Sometimes I don't feel like wearing full liners, so these have been a great option. The fabric is super comfy and I love the lace! I will say they are not perfect- I do get the occasional wedgie. Overall I have been happy with them though and they fit true to size. I am a 8-12 in pants, and the L fits me perfectly.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ingenious! I typically use sporks and tongs on trips. . . with the little "tong bridge" I get both. I love it. 
Oh, and I'm really a spork kind of person, so I bought a second spork- Now I have spork-spork-tongs.
review.name: I like sporks. . . and tongs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice utensils. Very lightweight, seem sturdy enough. Actually used the tonged attachment on a river trip last month, and it was great. I do wonder how long it will be before I lose that part, but even without it, the two pieces that nest well together are great.
review.name: Nice and light

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This set is so good for when you go camping or on a picnic very good quality as well can serve you as tongs or as single spoon and fork also very easy to clean and store
review.name: Great quality !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Handy lightweight fork and spoon set with a very well thought out addition of the silicone elbow connection which allows for them to be used as tongs. Very clever and handy.
review.name: Clever and handy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The seatosummit aluminum spork and knife cutlery set are perfect utensils for outdoors. They're lightweight and stackable, and I love how I can clip them to my bag. They are easy to clean and durable.
review.name: Made for outdoors!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality and very durable. Easy to clean and definitely portable. I can just hook them to my pack and go, which is really nice. I even use them for picnics at the park!
review.name: Good quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love this cutlery set that is ultralight and surprisingly strong. The spork and knife come with a carabiner to keep them organized and all the materials are durable aluminium. These are great for my camping trips and for more casual travel as well!
review.name: Sleek, durable material and great for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is so good to have for camping, they are high quality utensils and I love that it can be easily converted into tongs. Definitely something I didn’t know would be practical to have, but I’m happy to be able to try these out.
review.name: So cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What a handy little set to have and the versatility of it is great. I love how I can use the attachment to combine both spoon and fork to make tongs then be able to take apart to eat with. Easy to work with and not flimsy. Cleans easily and a space saver for camping. I’d recommend these.
review.name: Handy and a space saver

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight and stackable with other frontier cutlery, durable, easy to clean. They are excellent! I had a lot of features I wanted when looking for travel utensils, and this one got all of them.
1) I wanted something that I could keep in my purse that wouldn't be too heavy.
review.name: Love it

name: Frontier UL Cutlery 2-Piece Set

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 4th pair in a row of KEEN shoes that I've bought. I bought a 14 Wide and didn't feel that I needed a "break-in" period with these, they were great right out of the box. I recommend these to anyone looking for a great shoe that will last.
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Targhee 4 wide size 13 is a perfect fit for me. The other Keen shoes in 13w were not wide enough. This is my go to everyday shoe for slopping around in Seattle weather, beach, gardening etc. I’ll probably order the taller version too, as I like to rotate wearing different shoes so they last longer.
review.name: Call it Xtra wide

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Quite possible the most comfortable pair of shoes I’ve purchased. The only complaint I’d have is the shoe laces are too short and they refuse to stay tied.
review.name: Love’em!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It does take about two weeks to break in, but once broken in it's a nice feel on the foot, it walks very nice. The only issue I have for whatever reason I cannot get the strings tight enough. I'm going to purchase some lock places and I'm gonna see what happens.
review.name: Nice Feel

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I think the sizes are true. I needed an extra wide and liked this show but it only came in regular wide. Probably should have waited for extra wide.
review.name: Very nice show, but I really needed extra wide

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just took my first walk in these shoes. Based on that, I’m very impressed. They fit my feet perfectly, feel very comfortable, and supportive. Exactly what I’m looking for in a pair of walking shoes. I tend to break down running shoes very quickly, as I must walk heavily and run into things along the trail. Hiking shoes sometimes are too stiff and hard on my feet. These Targhee IVs seem to strike the perfect balance. One caution; they are heavy - for me it’s worth it to get the support and cushion I need. 

As I put more miles on these, I’ll update this review if my impressions begin to change.
review.name: Comfortable from the first, Solid and Supportive

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: My second pair of Targhee IV wide shoes. Now have both color options. I just hope they don't de-laminate at the soles like the older Targhee models did. I want a shoe that lasts.
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The insole for this new polyurethane midsole should have been updated. The shoe needs more cushion. Also, the laces have gotten even shorter. Why?
review.name: Needs work

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoe is made very well and I had high expectations, but they are not as comfortable as I had hoped. There seems to be some pressure on top of the shoe about 2-3” from the tip of the shoe. I have tried retying the shoe but no difference.
review.name: Somewhat dissapointed

review.itemreviewed: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Had to add gel cushions to fill to comfortable fit
review.name: Had to add gel cushions

name: Targhee IV WP Wide Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: We have taken it apart and put it back together several times to take it camping with us. It’s fairly easy to put together, even with just one person. So far it’s been really durable and can easily handle 3 large adults without it feeling sketchy.
review.name: worth the money!

review.reviewBody: This product is everything I hoped and more. First, backcountry is awesome and it arrived incredibly quickly. As for the product, laying around with friends and enjoying the breeze even when you don’t have trees is lovely. The build quality feels sturdy, so it works even for heavier individuals (290 here). If you’re on the fence about purchasing it, just go for it. Also, Eno is a great company.
review.name: Absolutely Amazing

review.reviewBody: I bought this during covid and it has been outside in the Arizona heat and rain for many years. the powder coating is holding up strong and so far no issues. I have taken it once camping and just threw it in the trailer. It is very durable and the family loves it. It dissasembles to smaller pieces. I only wish it came with multiple bags to Carry it or store it like how the Disco beds have. Buy it with confidence but it will take a good 15'x15' area.
review.name: Still no regrets

review.reviewBody: This thing is a hit! Our kids ranging from 3 to 11 are constantly playing, swinging, lounging, napping, and reading it when my wife and I aren't already using it. It's well made and sturdy. It comes with the hardware can carabiners. It's pretty easy to move around when I'm cutting the grass or taking it to the shaded part of our yard. It's not cheap but well worth it.
review.name: Such A Blast

name: ENOpod Hammock Stand

review.reviewBody: These Tip Protectors were on the tips during the fall so leaves didn't collect under the baskets. Worked wonderfully!

review.reviewBody: in the sierra the tink tink tink is too much and these are great to muffle that

review.reviewBody: These pole tip protectors seem to work well on hard surfaces. I have not yet used them on soft surfaces.
review.name: Pole Tip Protectors

review.reviewBody: I've used these over many years. They are the right component for the job. Quiet on hard surfaces, and soft enough that they don't slip.
review.name: Fine product!

review.reviewBody: go ahead and add BD Expedition 3 poles to that incompatible list. waste of time and money and can't return. they fall right off. not even close!!!!! garbage

review.reviewBody: These tip protectors are to loose on the pole. Both fell off while hiking several times. I had to wrap tape on the tip of the pole then put these back on over the tape. Solved the issue but not something I should have had to do. You were warned.
review.name: These WILL fall off

review.reviewBody: The pole tip protectors are great for walking on stone or cement. Also great for reducing impact to natural habitats in forests etc. Ideally, they would be included with all trekking poles. They are easy to attach and stay in place.
review.name: A must for city walking

review.reviewBody: The pole tips I was sent didn't fit the child size trekking poles I bought, altho I was assured they would when I called to order them. On my next call, the rep said there ARE no pole tip protectors for kid's poles!!! Black Diamond doesn't make them. Big hassle and bad policy to sell these kid's poles with no rubber tips for using on pavement and sidwalks. I'm very disappointed. Other companies do offer them for children's size poles.
review.name: Trekking pole tip protectors

review.reviewBody: Great! I bought a pair of these when I bought my trail cork trekking poles. I decided to order a second pair online, they seem great. Just wanted a back up…
review.name: Great! I bought a pair

review.reviewBody: these rubber tips provide excellent grip when traversing hard surfaces.
review.name: good grip

review.reviewBody: Do not waste your money! I originally bought this seat for my wife so she can enjoy watching my son play soccer on cold nights. The seat itself does great job at keeping you warm.  However, the back rest is terrible. As soon as you lean back there is absolutely no support. You just fall back and lean back into the bench behind you if there is one. I recommend trying a different vendor, especially for the price.
review.name: No back rest support!
comment:

For further questions or inquiries, you may also visit our contact us web form. On the Coleman website, select "contact us" from the drop-down menu after clicking the question mark logo in the top right corner, which will direct you to our contact web form.
