review.reviewBody: Used it for the first time at a football game and was extremely disappointed. There is no back support at all. In fact, the back leaned back so far it almost touched the row behind me. Very cheaply made.
review.name: Cheaply made
comment:
Hello! We regret that the quality of the Stadium Seat, didn’t meet your expectations. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. Furthermore, we will make sure that your thoughts are shared because we value and truly appreciate your feedback.

For further queries or concerns about your product, you can also visit the Coleman website. Choose “contact us” from the question mark logo in the upper right corner of the page to access our online contact form.

review.reviewBody: We didn’t even get a chance to try it with the heated function on. Used it at Volleyball and the back has no support at all and I couldn’t even sit in it comfortably. I actually had my husband remove it from the bleachers and I just sat on the bleachers. When he removed it, the frame was already bent. Good concept but very poor design.
review.name: Tried it one time for 5 minutes and hates it

review.reviewBody: Nice and warm. Works perfectly for really cold outtings with my grandbabies or parents. Everyone stayed warm
review.name: Wonderful

review.reviewBody: Nice padded seat but the frame sucks!  I have various stadium seats and although I like the battery and padded seat on this one the frame is not great and doesn’t provide much back support  unless it’s leaning against something. I finally cut it off the frame and just use the heated cushion part in another stadium seat.
review.name: Excellent heat seat, but poor frame design.
comment:
Hello, Amanda.

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and for taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman® OneSource™ Heated Stadium Seat & Rechargeable Battery. We're sorry to hear that the product's frame doesn't offer much back support unless it's leaning against something. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We apologize if you had a bad experience with our product. We fervently strive for such customer pleasure by consistently enhancing our services and products. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department.

Please, if you have any further questions or concerns about your product, kindly visit the Coleman website. First, click on the question mark logo in the upper right corner, then select "contact us," so you will be directed to our contact us web form.

Thank you very much, and have a wonderful day!

review.reviewBody: It looks good, but I can't give it full stars for 2 reasons: 1. Haven't had a chance to try it out yet. 2. If you are giving this for a gift, be aware THE BOX IT COMES IN TELLS WHAT IT IS.
review.name: The reason why
comment:
Hi there,

Thank you for posting a review and for choosing Coleman OneSource™ Heated Stadium Seat & Rechargeable Battery. We hope you will enjoy using it, especially this winter season. Have a wonderful day.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The OneSource product line from Coleman keeps getting better. Love that you can use the rechargeable batteries that these products come with across all the products. The stadium seat is great for sporting events. It provides back support and a nice cushion for your butt. The amazing bonus is that unlike other stadium seats, this one is heated. No longer need to sit on the cold metal bleacher or the hard wood bleacher with no back support. Setup was easy and it took a couple of hours to charge the battery. Depending on the heat settings this could last up to 3 hours on a single charge. I feel like that is a little short on time, especially if you need to start using it right away at an event. Overall the stadium seat is comfortable and easy to transport. Great for sporting events, around the house or camping. Basically whenever its cold out and you have to sit down.
review.name: Coleman Heated Stadium Seat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman heated stadium seat is life. I am so happy I got this. I honestly had no idea this existed I wish I had come across this sooner. I won’t be that cold during Friday football nights anymore because it gets very cold and the bleachers be freezing and I have to stand up because it be that cold. This was very easy to setup and get started it took a couple hours to charge the battery before I could use this that isn’t too bad because the battery last a while which I’m pleased with. I have been using this outside on my chair during my morning breeze routine and my nightly wind down relaxation time. I’ve been so comfortable because this not only keeps my bottom warm but my body also. The seat and and back cushion is also amazingly comfortable please get one of these if it’s for sports games, camping, or just to use at home you will not be disappointed.
review.name: I am ready for High School Football nights now

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This heated seat is absolutely perfect for any type of camping and I will also be using it once going to games and concerts become more accessible. It’s lightweight and very easy to use. What a fun accessory!
review.name: Camping Time!

name: Onesource Heated Stadium Seat Sioc

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this item and it is perfect for the cold weather
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Best winter jacket that I’ve ever owned. I just love it!!!
review.name: Awesome product!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a magnificent jacket with keen attention to detail and very high quality like you would expect from Assos.  However, after all the years I have been wearing Assos gear, I should have realized that these garments are cut for the slimmest guys.  I am slim but even the medium sized jacket was too tight.   I had to order two sizes up and hope that the large fits just right.
review.name: Great jacket but way too small!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've used this jacket for one season so far and it has been just what I needed.  In the 38-46 Degree range, I'll wear a short sleeve base layer under it and be fine for 2+ hour rides.  I'll switch to the Ultraz winter base layer for rides in the 25-38 Degree range and for rides below 25 Degrees, I'll typically add the mid-layer which has worked well down into the single digits (Fahrenheit).

I wear and Medium and was 5'7" and 178lb for the winter.  The jacket was roomie which was perfect for adding the mid layer.  I am now 165lbs and without the mid layer, the jacket feels quite loose in the core.

Hard efforts with weather warmer than 40 Degrees will probably require unzipping the jacket.  I typically switch to the Spring/Fall LS jersey with the base layer and a vest at that point, unless its raining.

Well worth the investment.
review.name: Excellent!  Well worth the money.

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I write this review two years after my purchase. This replaced a Bellwether jacket I used for probably 15-20 years. That jacket was so warm and I just needed a base layer to handle the majority of the coldest winter rides. I put a lot of effort into finding the next perfect jacket. I reviewed countless items on line and I never thought of going with Assos as it was by far the most expensive. I happened to be in an upscale bike shop somewhat local to me and they sold Assos products. I tried this jacket on and knew this was it. Luckily I was able to try one on because my normal size was too small in this line. I had to size up to an XL from an M. Well, I have now used this for two seasons and I could not be any happier - even with their customer service. Oddly, my zipper corroded and they replaced it without issue. My experience follows the others in that you do need much to keep warm with this jacket (I use my Skinfoil winter long-sleeve base layer most times) and I find can be a bit much once it is over 40°F but just pull the zipper down. Mine happens to have the integrated hood and I have used it about a dozen times, and it is a very nice add-on. This and the Skinfoil were my first ASSOS products and I just purchased the Mille GT spring/fall knickers and as expected, this is of the quality I have come to expect with this company.
review.name: Ultimate winter jacket

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ride with this jacket in sub 20F NY weather all the time. Warmth is never an issue even with high windchill.  When the temps get into mid 30s you have to unzip to vent because of how well it insulates.
review.name: Handles extreme cold well

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
It is a well co trusted jacket.  Wind proof and I wore it w a base layer.  Once you get riding it is good.  I did find my arms getting reallly warm and had to vent. My sleeves not to sweat.  Maybe since I had a long sleeve base layer.

I haven't tried with the below 30 weather.  I think it would be fine with more layers.  It is a little roomy not as super fit as other assos I have since believe that is was designed like that.  6' 155lb. Wore a large.  I wish it was a little tighter fitting.
review.name: Great jacket from 35-40 degrees
comment: Warm arms sounds nice to me. That's the first thing, after my hands, that gets cold. Ya at 6' 155 I might expect it to be a bit roomy. If it works at 30 F that's not bad w. just a base layer. At 35-40 ehh no big deal. Thanks for the review. Helpful,

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ok, first and foremost - it's warm.  Started my first ride in it this morning at 37 degrees with a 32 degree wind chill.  Only a light merino LS base layer underneath.  20 minutes in, and I had to pull the zipper down just a bit to allow some cold air in.  To be honest, at this temp I may actually just wear a short sleeve base layer and see how the jacket handles it.  As far as the fit goes, if you're a medium in everything else, get a medium.  It's snug of course, but pretty much disappears on the bike.  I'm 5'8, 155lbs with maybe a 38 chest if that helps.  The sleeves are pretty cool - they're actually two piece as the warm, soft material isn't sewn to the outer windproof layer, so you can tuck the under layer into your gloves and pull the outer cuff over the top.  I liked this feature.  A couple of "maybe" negatives for me - first of course, is this thing is expensive.  But if you're reading this pending a purchase, you've already probably swallowed that so YMMV.  Second - when I got home and peeled this thing off, my base layer was pretty darn wet.  Now maybe that's a function of the merino wool, a negative strike on this jacket's breathability, the fact that it really wasn't frigid out, whatever.  Just figured I'd point that out if you're expecting this to keep you bone dry.  It didn't.  Beyond that, it kept me warm (almost too much at this temp) and I guess that's what you're looking for in a winter jacket, right?

Oh one more thing - if you've read previous reviews, make sure you know that this is the "updated" version (2021?).  It does not include the built in neck warmer/buff, which I was kind of looking forward to.  Guess Assos decided that this wasn't worth continuing.

Edit - a month in, and this is clearly the gold standard of winter jackets if you're riding in the cold.  I've been down to 22F so far and this thing just shrugs it off like you're sitting on a summer beach.  My upper limit before I'm just too warm in this jacket is maybe 43/44F.  It's that warm but not even remotely "bulky".  Assos killed it with this jacket.  Think it's time to pick up the matching bib tights to see how ridiculously cold I can go....
review.name: Yeah, it's warm...
comment: The new GTO Bib tights are not the same. They say they are rated for the coldest Temps but they lack windproof fabric anywhere but the cup and they start to get chill under 40F even worse at freezing. So expensive but not worth it for the cold, only comfort.

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well worth the money.
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wow, finally a jacket that is comfortable, wind-proof and warm from 45 F down.  My main issue with my other winter jackets was the wind protection, especially in the arm sections.  I took this bad boy out the other day with the temp starting at around 36 F and ended around 45 F.  Wind was between 12-16 MPH.  I wore an Assos, long sleeved,  winter skinfoil 4.4 base layer under the jacket.   First 15-20 minutes of the ride, I was questioning my purchase.  After an hour on the bike, I was noticing that I was comfortable and not thinking about the weather.  2 hours into my ride I was not thinking about the jacket at all (it was doing its job).  Especially when I was riding straight into a head wind of 16 MPH for numerous miles.  I could not feel the wind through this jacket!!!!  After my three hours in the cold was up, I was contemplating buying a second jacket in the lollyRed (just joking!).  This is an outstanding jacket.  Once you get over the $369 price tag, everything else is great.   In this instance, you get what you pay for.  If you are looking for a winter jacket that will battle the cold and wind, look no further.  The jacket actually does everything it claims to.   I am a 51 year old, 5'10", 190 lb. weekend warrior rider.  I only ride 2 times a week.  Each ride is between 50-60 miles.   I am in great shape, but would definitely be considered a "bigger" rider in the peloton.   I usually wear an XL in all of my Assos Kit.  I did go up to the XLG because I felt the XL was just a "smidge" too tight.  After I wore the jacket on my first ride, I probably would have been OK with the XL, but I like the "roomier" fit of the XLG for my winter rides.   I can not wait to see what the limits (cold temp) of this jacket will be.  I feel that with my winter Assos skinfoil 4.4 base layer, I should be fine down to low to mid 20's F.
review.name: Proper Winter Jacket

name: Mille GT Ultraz EVO Winter Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket two months ago, and I really like it. However, I've only worn it a few times and haven't even washed it yet. The 'HYDRATIC' text at the end of the left sleeve is already peeling off. Is it coming off too quickly? If I had used it for six months or a year, I wouldn't mind.
review.name: The 'HYDRATIC' text was peeling off in two months

review.reviewBody: I bought the new orange version of this jacket in XL. It was perfect. Super stylish, fantastic fit, lovely colour - it was everything I wanted in a rain jacket... until I wore it in the rain. That's what led me to give this jacket a two-star review. I wore it for the first time to work on a rainy day, and walked from one building to another across the street for a total distance of 20 meters. There were large splotches of moisture on certain parts of the jacket, so I opened it up to check to see if any got through, and it did. I'm confident that it wasn't condensation, because of the duration and temperature outside, so it was clearly water soaking through. I immediately brought it back and returned without issue, which was appreciated. I'm really disappointed because I absolutely loved the style of the jacket. If they could make it waterproof like they say it was, I'd immediately buy it again. I love Fjallraven, and have bought a number of their products in the past. This was the first time I was let down, so I'm hoping they correct this production/design error.
review.name: Best and Worst Jacket Ever

review.reviewBody: I can confirm that you'll become wet in this jacket very quickly. I can't say whether it's because the jacket not being waterproof or because of an internal moisture. I expected much more from the brand
review.name: You'll be wet

review.reviewBody: Soaks through after 20 mins in moderate rain.
review.name: Does "hydratic" mean "waters flows through freely"

review.reviewBody: After 30 minutes in rain this jacket is 50% saturated. On the plus side.. it looks good and fits nicely. Conversely, the matching pants do seem to be living up to the waterproof claim.
review.name: NOT waterproof. .

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof per other reviews! Very expensive jacket that does not protect in a 30 minute shower. Sizing is fine.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody:
The jacket is good for light rain and it should keep you clean of the water FOR some hours. However, water seem to get into the fabric making it wet   overtime
  so I recommend having another  jacket or clothes under it. or just buy a Gortex jacket.
review.name: Light rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: I don’t wear this as a shell jacket I wear this as a warm weather rain jacket and its perfect for that. Im 6’ 250lbs and muscular build and I prefer XL with a tshirt underneath
review.name: Nice and dry

review.reviewBody:
I've been watching a number of reviews prior to purchasing this rain jacket, and finally pulled the trigger when I had an opportunity to try it on in store.  The mustard colour is great in person, but what I'm really impressed with is the build quality.  All of the reviews talk highly of how well constructed this jacket is, and I can't disagree.  What I wasn't expecting was how the slight stretch in the jacket would clearly separate it from other similar rain jackets from other brands.  It makes it a very comfortable rain jacket.
My only knock?  Sizing is really confusing and I'm glad I was able to try it on in store.  Based on the size guide, I would have purchased an XXL online.  I have a 46" chest (6'4" and around 225 lbs).  My Abisko trail fleeces are XXL.  My Abisko Midsummer jacket is an XL.  I bought a L.  This isn't without precedent:  I have a Greenland jacket in a L, and it fits fine.  You might say "you'll never be able to layer with it!"  Well... I went looking for a thick fleece in store and had it under the jacket and it fit fine.  So yeah - this jacket fits large.  I think I would have been fine with an XL, but I like the slightly slimmer fit of the L.
review.name: Exactly what I thought the jacket would be

review.reviewBody: Amazing product. I bike and hike in the northeast and this jacket has held up in some pretty bad weather.
review.name: Above and beyond

name: HC Hydratic Trail Jacket - Men's

I have tried two from Castelli, one from Spatzwear and this one from Giordana. This is the one I reach for over and over. Great race fit, great pockets, perfect for a 30 miler or 100 miler. review.reviewBody:

Otherwise fabric and stitching was nice.  Fabric is very see-through, though (look at the nipples even on the black fabric in the picture above), especially the yellow.

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Doppio Short-Sleeve Suit - Men's

This is my first "suit" experience and I can't believe it's taken me so long!  Love not having saggy pockets and being able to unzip without feeling like a superhero wearing a cape.

The only thing I wish for is a lower collar, I don't see the need for it to come up as high as it does.  Not a deal breaker tho.
review.name: Pretty close to 5 stars

name: FR-C Pro Doppio Short-Sleeve Suit - Men's

review.name: Performs great.

review.reviewBody: Light weight and comfortable, very suitable for long days scrambling and climbing. Easy to adjust the size of the helmet and inset extra padding should required.
review.name: Super comfortable and reliable helmet

review.reviewBody: I love the look and the weight. The strap system is a little weird though. Maybe it's my head shape and ear position but my ears barely make it into the opening, meaning the clips that go under my ears rub against my lobes at times. My sizing is right in the middle of the small size range, so I would expect there to be extra space for larger heads in this range, I feel like I've already maxed out the size range. I've only worn the helmet 2 times at the crag, but I'll keep using it and see how annoying that gets.
review.name: Lightweight but finicky fit

review.reviewBody: This is a great all around helmet, I've used it on long alpine days as well as crag days and it is great in either use case. I really like the extra security of the MIPS system and the hardshell design.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet - I bought it as a light ski mountaineering helmet, but I've also used it as my main climbing helmet due to great overhead protection. The only downside I read about with this helmet was the headlamp straps being finicky, but they're not too bad. Besides, it's not often you have to attach and detach your headlamp in a day anyway!
review.name: Light and protective!

review.reviewBody:
Never worn a lighter helmet. Feels like I’m wearing nothing to the point I’ll drive home from the crag with it on. It’s taken a rope or two across the top and no impact shown whatsoever across the entire helmet. 

Chin strap can be awkward at times but that might be dependent on jaw shape.

I've taken this helmet climbing out on the crags a few time now and it checks all the boxes: comfortable, light weight and has protected my head from striking more than a few stone outcropping during my ascents.
review.name: Comfortable, light weight protection

review.reviewBody: The helmet is extremely light and the added MIPS protections gives you peace of mind. The adjustment straps are simple to keep the helmet light but I would of preferred a crank like adjustment although keep in mind anything like that would only add weight. Overall regardless of the adjustment system the helmet is awesome.
review.name: Light as a feather!

review.reviewBody: I used this helmet for mountaineering and touring, as well as some climbing trips. It's lightweight and the size adjuster makes sense after getting used to it. The clips for the headlamp are hard to use, but it held the strap in well. There are cheaper ones out there if you're newer to these sports but I highly recommend the wall rider- a good all around option.
review.name: Great lightweight helmet

name: Wall Rider Mips Climbing Helmet

review.reviewBody: I think the BOA system is great for snowboard boots, but I think velcro is better for MTB shoes. I can't get the same level of tightness that I like in my shoes from the BOA system as I can with velcro, and velcro is marginally less convenient. I'd just save yourself the extra cost for the BOA system, especially if you like a tight fit.
review.name: BOA system is inferior to velcro

review.reviewBody: I've been riding Sidis for 30 years, thought I'd try something different. Shimano got their act together with these, after failures many years ago. Almost the same awesome fit as the italian brand, and lighter weight for the bonus. Nice and stiff for power but far more walkable than hard plastic soles. Nicely ventilated for the summer. Can't beat the low price for such a good shoe.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I use these with my Schwinn IC4 indoor cycling bike and they work perfectly. Love that I can walk around in them without worrying about hitting the clips on the floor.
review.name: Perfect for Schwinn IC4

review.reviewBody: The shoes are comfortable and easy to secure, however, I?ve had them only two months and the soles are getting torn up and shredded by the bike pedals.
review.name: Comfy but not the best quality

review.reviewBody: I use these on my road bike, and ordered them because I wanted more traction during the winter months and these give me that. I had been a holdout switching away from pure road bike shoes, but with slicker roads/asphalt right now, these were a great investment and I may use them quite a bit in all weather. One of the reasons I like road bike shoes is because I have a really narrow foot, and these shoes are a bit wide for me, but with thicker seasonal socks I currently wear, I can mitigate the wider build in these. It might just be that MTB shoes are wider across the board. No complaints with these shoes at all. Fair price, solid investment.
review.name: Very good traction

name: XC3 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.name: Nice pack, poor durability

review.reviewBody: Summit rainier with it. Amazing product, comfy, light, and with a huge capacity. Lot of room inside but also outside with many options to tie things outside. I strongly recommend this bag.
review.name: Amazing backpack

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with heavy loads, and well dialed features for mountain objectives. My preference would be to have a sleeve for an avi shovel and probe, but as is, it’s a great pack.

This pack is excellent for longer expeditions where you need to hold a ton of gear and food. Lots of great organizational features, and overall just very smartly designed. My only complaint is the edges of the pad on the lower back can be extremely irritating if you are only wearing a baselayer.
review.name: Quality pack with great features, not the most comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Clear lots of thought went into these. I use this as my all around climbing pack, holds a ton of gear really well but can be lightened up fairly easy if needed. Gets a lot of use (100 days a year) and still looks nearly new. Tons of well thought out compartments. This thing is great.

My only complaint is the chest strap, designed to be removable, is not good at staying in place unless buckled and in use. Nearly lost it a few times, now it stays in the zippered pouch on the top pack unless I want it for longer hikes.
review.name: Awesome pack.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Denali after reading many many reviews of other brands and knowing that you can’t go wrong with the Denali ! This backpack in the previous versions have been at rhe top of the world and in so many other moubtains !! I use it in Aconcagua with my friends. Hiking to the base camp and I wasn’t sore on my shoulders and lower back . The harness system is great! I would definitely recommend it !
review.name: Great space !!

review.reviewBody: This is supposed to be an expedition pack for long climbs or distances. Well let me tell you, after taking it on just a 3 day trip it left bruises on my hips, lower back, and my shoulders felt as if they couldn't go on anymore. The measurements for this pack are not correct for aligning it with your torso/spine, I have the alpinisto and it is more comfortable than this piece of junk. Can't believe I spent so much money on something that I absolutely will not take up Denali next summer. Honestly glad it couldn't happen this year and didn't have to use this pack on it. It would've been impossible to carry and drag everything needed for a trip like that. I'll be saving up and spending my money elsewhere on another pack so that I don't have to feel like I'm being tortured by what is supposed to be one of the most comfortable pieces of equipment on big expeditions. My wife even wore this for part of our 40 mile loop in the winds because my body couldn't handle it anymore, I literally had to make a padded belt out of my fleece just so I could bear the weight in my pack, which wasn't even that much. If I could give this pack 0 stars, I would.
review.name: Terrible

name: Denali 75 Backpack - 4577cu in

review.reviewBody:
I bought these shorts because I have some other Rabbit shorts that have held up very well for running,  however these shorts I discovered has serious flaws that prevent them from being excellent running shorts.
  
1.  The liner inside is very baggy, it does not keep everything secure was your running and frequently you'll experience chaffing and having to constantly adjust yourself while running can be very problematic especially in public.  I usually wear XL Rabbit shorts and never have this issue. 
2.  The side splits are not very wide compared to other Rabbit shorts and your freedom of movement is limited.
3.  Using them as swim shorts after your workout, expect long try times in the sun.  

I really like the pockets and the design but the functionality of being a running short, i'll stick to the Rabbit products i'm familar with like surf n turf 4" from few years ago which had a much better design and functionality than the Beach Break 5"
review.name: Do not compare to other Rabbit shorts!

name: Beach Break 5in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are well-made, very comfortable and allow full range of movement without shifting. They are thin but sized generously enough to wear over layers. Zippers at the ankles seem like good quality and are long enough to accommodate taking on/off boots. The back pocket would be a little awkward if used. My biggest complaint is the calfs and ankles are quite loose and the inseam is longer than the 30.3 - 31.5in stated in the size chart for a Medium. The true inseam of the Medium is 33in. If your boots are bulky and you don't mind the pants bunching up (or wear a long inseam), they're fine. Waistband measurement is accurate - about 31in and seems like it will stretch to at least 38in comfortably (bottom of the waistband sits just above the hip, not at the natural waist). Just disappointing such a simple, objective specification isn't accurate.
review.name: Runs large - inaccurate size chart

review.reviewBody: These pants feel amazing, lightweight and soft.  Stretchy, I can move in all directions.  I can do a full squat with out readjusting anything.  I got the light blue color and there is a fun orange colored accent on the inside waists band and ankle bands.  I got a few other items from this brand, and it’s all great!
review.name: Super awesome pants

review.reviewBody: The item I received doesn't match the pants shown in the photo. They are similar, but don't have the red accents on the pocket and cuff zippers. The grey fabric on the back is also much darker, so the pants look pretty much entirely black.
review.name: pants don't match the photo

name: Power Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Tested my new sleeping bag over this past weekend in a Yorkshire bothy. Temperature dropped to -3 overnight, combined with a Stratosphere 5.5 mat, cotton liner and thermal underwear - I was comfy all night.
review.name: Tested my new sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: There is nothing more snuggly than wriggling into a sleeping bag which warms up quickly when the weather is cold and grim outside - this sleeping bag does it all. I simply LOVE LOVE LOVE it. I went for the women's fit so it's not too long (I'm 160cm tall). It packs up really small (been used for mountain marathons) but retains all of it's loft even after being packed down for a few days, I love the fact the zip has an anti catch zip on it and the bottom zip opens independently should your feet need cooling down.
review.name: When you look forward to going to bed

review.reviewBody: It’s light, it’s warm, the pertex shell feels robust and damp repellent. Packs down into the bike bag brilliantly and the long size is a dream.
review.name: It’s light, it’s warm, the

review.reviewBody: Weight to warmth ratio is amazing. Lofts really well out of the niffty dry bag it comes with. Also included is a nice storage bag. A very high quality product that should over 20 years of service. My last RAB bag has.
review.name: Weight to warmth ratio is

review.reviewBody: Bag arrived promptly, beautiful. Got my first Rab bag in 1995 for a Denali trip. It's still great but too hot and heavy for the more mundane UK work these days. This has been perfect so far for the couple of nights out I have used it the weight for warmth is first class. Thank you.

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch D-Route 17L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: D-Route 17L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch D-Route 17L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Tough, light, versatile, looks great. This is the best back I've found for inbounds skiing (with the occasional bootpack or slackcountry excursion). Highly recommend.
review.name: Best In-bounds Pack

review.reviewBody: Used as an inbounds resort pack and it was great!  Didn’t even know it was there. Worked great wearing on the lift also
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody:
I can fit everything I need for a day of inbounds skiing. You can barely tell it’s there while riding and the buckles are super easy to work with your gloves on. 
Could possibly use a side compression strap to keep things from accumulating towards the bottom but that’s just being a bit nitpicky.
review.name: Perfect for inbounds skiing

review.reviewBody: Just finished a one day ski of Mt Baker with the D, and wingman pocket. Did a slight mod to carry the ice ax. Plenty of room for extra layers and glacier gear. With the wingman you can get a ton done with this pack!
review.name: Big enough

review.reviewBody: Got this product to be my commuter back. Was looking for MR quality of build, funcionality and rain resistant. Out of the box seems like a cheaply made product that will not stand the test of time. Waist strap is tiny and narrow. Would be ok to hold your lunch and a small bottle of water, but anything with much weight, this pack would be uncomfortable and not hold up well. Sorry MR, nothing like the firepack I own...
review.name: Hope it survives

review.reviewBody: Purchased this pack just before heading west for a week of snowboarding. I've owned the larger version (Saddle Peak) for years but wanted something smaller for this trip. The D-Route proved perfect. Large enough for an extra layer, water bladder, repair kit, and a small SLR camera. Top pocket is small, but still accommodates a few essentials that you want easier access to throughout the day. The side zip access is a real bonus - makes it super easy to dig out small items that inevitably make their way to the bottom of the pack during the day. The overall low profile was great when riding the lifts - so much so that I didn't feel the need to remove it while loading. Well built, and worth the price.
review.name: Ideal for the Resort Skier/Boarder

review.reviewBody: It's a nice little pack for slack-country laps, but the one I received was lacking in quality control. One of the cinch straps for the lid is significantly shorter compromising the pack's carrying capacity. Most likely someone got to the end of the webbing spool and simply did not care about the end product. Still functional and probably a rare occurrence, but disappointing.
review.name: Nice, but lacking quality control

review.reviewBody:
Bought this for resort sidecountry, and morning bootpacks up Mt. Glory. Both it does extremely well. Large enough to stuff a few essentials, but small enough to keep you from overloading. This is likely not your "all-day tour" pack, nor is it really designed to be. If you have other packs, and you are in the market for a minimalist option, this is it.

The only improvement I would suggest would be to make the torso a bit taller, but I'm 6'3" with large shoulders so feels a bit small, but not unusably so. Probably not an issue for the average person.
review.name: Perfect for minimal missions

review.reviewBody: This pack is perfect for quick laps in the slackcountry.  Enough room for a probe, shovel, skins, water, a FAK, and a snack.  Also great for in bounds skiing especially with small children when you need to carry more than fits in a jacket.  The slim profile makes it easy to wear on a lift and the side zip make the contents easily accessible.
review.name: Just the basics

review.reviewBody: When I purchased I thought it was designed for  inbounds hiking, only having splitboard carry options and no snowboard carry is inconvenient.
review.name: Wish it worked with a snowboard!

name: D-Route 17L Backpack

review.name: Balaclava

review.reviewBody: Fits perfect, breathable material, and warm enough for harsh Wisconsin weather.!
review.name: I would definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Northface ski mask, and I couldn't be more thrilled with my decision! This mask not only provides an unbeatable level of warmth and protection against the elements, but it also boasts a sleek and stylish design that I adore. The fit is perfect-snug yet comfortable, allowing for unrestricted movement while keeping out the cold air. I've worn it during both ski trips and casual outings, and it performs exceptionally well in all conditions. The breathable fabric is a game-changer, as it prevents overheating during high activity levels while still offering that essential warmth. Moreover, the craftsmanship is top-notch. The seams are well-constructed, and the materials feel durable enough to last many winters to come. I also appreciate the versatility; it can easily be adjusted to suit different weather conditions, making it a must-have for any outdoor enthusiast. Overall, I highly recommend the Northface ski mask to anyone looking for reliable winter gear. It combines functionality, comfort, and style flawlessly, making it an invaluable addition to my winter wardrobe!
review.name: Exceptional Performance and Comfort: A Review of the Northfa

review.reviewBody: Fits really well, keeps me warm and provides that extra layer when I'm working outside iup in the mountains when it's snowing. I'm a Traffic Control Flagger so having my ears and neck warm helps alot.
review.name: I would buy this product and recommend to family & friends.

review.reviewBody: Both for skiing and pond hockey, the fit is perfect!
review.name: Definitely would recommend!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, fits well and keeps me warm in the weather I use it for. This was a great purchase and I'd recommend it to anyone interested.
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: Love this pants! I'm a short guy so I had to get that short length which worked great for me! I did he a size a little bigger with pants which work great with a belt just in case if more insulation clothes. I was Norway which it was in the 20 and I had one layer of long John's which kept me warm the whole night (hunting for the northern lights) I definitely recommend
review.name: Kept me warm in Norway trip!

review.reviewBody: These pant look great and fit great. Hopefully they will be equally warm. TNF makes the best gear around.

review.reviewBody: For cold weather sports, the North Face is always dependable. Love these snow pants!
review.name: The Go-To

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ski every day in the winter in the northeast and the weather is obviously variable and the Freedom pants have never let me down. This pair will be my 4th pair, not because they have worn out but I like back up pairs. I own both insulated and non insulated and both are phenomenal at keeping me dry whether it's heavy snow or rain - I have never had wet legs in the several years of using them. I also applaud them for the sizing - others I've had over my career have not fit perfectly like the Freedom pants do. I highly recommend them to my cohorts in the business.
review.name: In my opinion the best outdoor pants available.

review.reviewBody: I had been so happy with my Hoka shoes, especially the Arahi 6. They wear out fast but my feet were in heaven. Now Hoka has changed the arahi to the 7 and they aren't the same. They feel cheap and are uncomfortable.
review.name: Changed arahi

review.reviewBody: Helps with plantar fasciitis and Achilles tendinitis discomfort.
review.name: So comfortable I bought a second pair.

review.reviewBody: It truly is a stability shoe. Very comfortable for my medium-width pronating feet, and the toe box is comfortable but not excessively wide.
review.name: I love this shoe!

review.reviewBody: My doctor recommended "Hoka" for my hip and foot pain. I was skeptical.... I never spend that much on myself for shoes - I picked out the white Arahi7 and sent the link to my doctor before purchase, he approved, I purchased. My ankle/Achilles pain is so much better. I love the fact that I could purchase white ! I would recommend this shoe to everyone ! I have also got several compliments on the shoe itself, the color and the look.
review.name: First time buyer

review.reviewBody: Use it for walking. Lightweight fits snuggly around the ankle for extra support. Like the rounder toe box.
review.name: Would definitely buy these sneakers again.

review.reviewBody: The color was lighter than it looked online but these sneakers are amazing. You do need to break them in but it's like walking on air.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: I have worn these shoes in the 6's and that were the most comfortable shoe. I got the new 7's and they are horrible. Narrow and hard like a rock. They kill my feet. I was so disappointed when I got my shoes.
review.name: Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: These are definitely not as cushiony as I prefer. It took several wears for them to be comfortable, and even then I'm not thrilled.
review.name: Not comfortable

review.reviewBody: I've been faithfully wearing Hokas for years. I went to buy new running shoes and was shocked at the difference in the new Arahi. The toe bed of the 7 is significantly more narrow and for someone who needs a wider toe bed it is not comfortable. I need to find a replacement shoe :-(
review.name: So Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I am very pleased with the quality of these shoes. My shifts are typically pretty long and involve thousands of steps e every day. As someone with flat feet I've been desperate to find something that's reliable without having to mess with insoles anymore. These provide the kind of support I need while being lightweight and durable.
review.name: Solid choice for flat feet and long hours

name: Arahi 7 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love my Kari Traa wool base layer Rose High Waisted pants. They are great as a base layer and as pajama bottoms. Soft, warm, easy to wash and hang dry. Can’t ask for much more than that
review.name: Soft and Warm

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these base layer pants.  The waistband is soft and comfortable.  The fabric is soft, warm, and comfy.  The shaping at the waist in back allows great freedom of movement with no pulling down as I bend and stretch.  It washes nicely with the machine cold cycle.  It even dries nicely using the no heat timed cycle on my dryer—then lay it flat to finish.  Best base layer pants!
review.name: Best base layer bottoms

review.reviewBody: I LIVE IN THIS SET!!! These are the best merino wool base layer pants! It’s so hard to find high waist base layers and Kari Traa nailed it with this base layer! The high waist is so comfy and flattering and I love that it’s a thicker waistband too. I got the taupe color and it is so pretty! It’s perfect for lounging, skiing, and apres-ing! I’ve never gotten so many compliments, 100% recommend and will be getting in every color! I got in a small and sizing is true to size.
review.name: Only Baselayers I'll Ever Buy!

review.reviewBody: I am really happy with these base layer bottoms, the high waist makes them very comfortable for long ski/ hiking days and the are super warm and soft. The patterns are also super fun and stand out. I am a true medium and they fit well, although if you want a tigher fit I would recommend sizing down.
review.name: Best Baselayers

review.reviewBody: These Merino Wool Kari Traa Rose High Waist Pants are amazingly soft and comfortable - and they look great too! They're perfect for wearing around the house on cold winter evenings. I ordered a size Large, but could probably fit into a Medium if I wanted them to be a bit more snug.  I'll be ordering another pair for sure.
review.name: Luxuriously Soft, Comfortable and  Warm

name: Rose High Waist Pant - Women's
